all_questions.question: What happens when trying to create a multilingual system to produce non-English languages during training?
all_questions.context: But when we do the other direction, when we try to create this multilingual system to actually produce the non-English, the non-common language in the setup, then sometimes it helps and sometimes it significantly decreases the performance.

all_questions.question: Why does having English-German training data in the English-French translation cause a problem?
all_questions.context: So, for example, having English-German training data in the English-French translation, that will give you a big loss because it will probably learn the German word, or the end, will try to produce it in French as well and that's a bad idea.

all_questions.question: What is the effect of oversampling on language corpora sizes?
all_questions.context: And it's also related to the oversampling, the sizes, the mutual sizes of the corpora. the French and German were of different sizes and either you preserve the original distribution or you could skew it so that they are on par and in each of the cases you get a loss in one of the languages.

all_questions.question: What is the consequence of preserving the original distribution between language corpora?
all_questions.context: in each of the cases you get a loss in one of the languages.

all_questions.question: Why are experiments with multilingual systems not very promising?
